--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2020/0370 b) Date of Occurrence: 23/08/2024
c) Installation Details: Cyclops Vision - AC-9113-559 at
Maintenance Hub-Y
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Electrical b) Date Component 27/08/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Generator Control d) Main Assembly: Station-3 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Generator Control Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-B
g) Part No.: EL-4705-T2 h) Sl No.: SN-6183-435
i) Firmware Version: FW-8.31.184 j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 29/01/2020 l) Date of Removal: 24/08/2024
Pg No: 118 Ln No: 19 Pg No: 129 Ln No: 18
m) Manufacturing Agency: Skyward Defense Systems n) Date, Month & Year June 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 785 Hrs / 1883 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Inverter output voltage deviation. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Generator Control component.
Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Implement enhanced testing protocol before component installation
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Conduct fleet-wide inspection campaign
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Technical evaluation completed. Proposed preventive measures are appropriate and align with design intent.
Date: 23/09/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing.
Date: 26/09/2024 Signature: Dr. A.K. Sharma
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations.
Date: 24/09/2024 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 29/09/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 28/09/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
